1.content:
My name is Amelia Tucker; I’m the Director of Public Relations for Benson Financial Services, a company was started by my dad George Benson. I live in a quiet neighborhood with my husband Garrett and our twin sons, Jamie and Andrew.

Why am I telling you all of this? I’m telling you this because I wasn’t always a 26-year-old married woman with two, soon to be three, children. In fact; up until about 2 years ago, I wasn’t even a woman. My name used to be Andrew Benson; and I was a spoiled, misogynistic bastard.

Everything that I had in my life had been given to me; I never had to work for anything. But that was nothing compared to how I treated women – not even close. I thought that I was God’s gift to women and that I could do whatever I wanted with them.

I thought everything was going great for me; I had an amazing girlfriend and a well-paying job at my dad’s company. That was until I slipped up and made a complete ass of myself at a company party. As a result, I was forced to live as a woman for a year; working as an assistant to a man that I’d recently hired.

They say you have to hit rock bottom before you can build yourself back up. That was certainly the case for me; as it took losing everything that I thought was important to find out that I actually had nothing.

The following is a chronicle of everything that changed me from the man I was to the woman I became.
1.title: A Preface

11.content:
I was in a great mood as I walked out of my condo that Monday after the July 4th weekend. After going to a company party, I spent the weekend with some old frat buddies; we drank, got some girls – it was a blast.

As I entered the parking garage, I walked towards my recently purchased 2019 BMW 3 Series. When I bought that car, I told myself I was doing it to get girls. Now whenever I see some guy driving around in one, I can’t help but think he’s just overcompensating for something. None of my single girlfriends found guys who have them to be very attractive.

Climbing into the car, I heard my cell phone start to ring. A quick look at the dash showed it was my girl, Heather. With a smile on my face, I answered it and said, “Hey babe, I missed you this weekend.”

“Did you really miss me, Andrew?” angry, Heather said, “Seems to me like you had plenty of fun without me this weekend.”

I had no idea what Heather was talking about as I pulled out of the parking garage. “Whoa babe, what are you talking about?”

“I saw Danny’s Instagram, you bastard; you were making out with that blonde slut at his condo.”

“First off, she’s not a slut.”

“So that’s supposed to make it alright?” scoffing, Heather said, “I’m tired of being treated like I don’t matter; I deserve a real guy who loves me. We’re through!”

Heather ended the call before I could respond. With the benefit of hindsight, Heather was right; she did deserve a better guy. I’m happy to say that she did; having just gotten engaged to a great guy who treats her better than Andrew ever did.

The abrupt end of my relationship with Heather put a damper on my spirits as I continued the drive into work. But it didn’t last long, because within minutes I’d already decided to go to the bar tonight and find some girl to bring home. “There are plenty of girls out there for me; I’ll have a new girlfriend by the end of the night.”

I hope that my sons won’t treat women like that when they’re older. I also hope they’ll protect their sister from men like that – that’s right, Garrett and I just found out we’re having a girl.

I pulled into the Gateway Business Park ten minutes later; driving up to my reserved spot outside the building that housed the family business – Benson Financial Services. Getting out of the car, I walked into the building; waving at the receptionist as I walked by. I was a bit confused when I saw her simply glare at me as I walked by, but I brushed it off as I took the elevator to the 3rd floor.

As I walked down the hall I came across my secretary, the beautiful Ms. Jessica Robinson, standing in front of the filing cabinet with her back turned to me. Maybe I’ll ask her out for drinks tonight. Walking up behind her, I grabbed her by the waist and said, “Good morning, beautiful.”

Jessica reacted by squealing in shock as she pulled away. Turning to look at me, her a mixture of fright and anger, she said, “Good morning, Mr. Benson.”

Walking past her, into my office, I said, “What do I have on the schedule today, Ms. Robinson?”

“Your father wanted to see you as soon as you came in.”

“I suppose I could make time for the old man.” Sighing, I said, “When I get back, I want to see the paperwork on the River Freight account.”

I want to stress that I now have a good relationship with my Dad; he’s been nothing but supportive with everything over the last few years. I know it sounds cliché, but I likely wouldn’t be the woman I am today if it weren’t for him.

I went down the hall and took the elevator to the 4th floor. As I got out of the elevator, I walked by a small number of women standing by the copier. It was then that I started to notice a pattern; a lot of women were giving me angry looks today. What did I ever do to them?

I stopped outside of my dad’s office; seeing his secretary, Helen Potts, sitting at her desk. Good morning, Helen; I’m here to speak with my father.”

“Go right in, Mr. Benson; he’s been waiting for you.”

Walking passed her; I opened the door and walked into Dad’s office. I found him sitting at his desk with Michelle Harding, the company lawyer, standing behind him. “Hey, Dad, what’s up?”

“Close the door and have a seat, Andrew.”

Closing the door, wondering what was going on, I took a seat across from him. “What’s going on, Dad?” looking at Michelle, I said, “Why’s Michelle here?”

“It seems you’ve dug yourself into quite a hole, Andrew.” Sighing, Dad said, “Half the secretarial has threatened to file a sexual harassment lawsuit because of your actions at the party Friday night.”

What’s wrong with how I acted at the party? “What’s the big deal, so I had a couple of drinks and had some fun?”

“I’ve received complaints from eight women who said you were behaving inappropriately towards them at the party.” Opening the file in her hands, Michelle pushed it towards me and said, “While most of the complaints state you harassed them with flirtatious behavior, some of them stated you touched them inappropriately.”

“Oh come on, that’s all bullshit.” Scoffing, I turned to Dad and said, “I’ve always been nothing but a gentleman to the female staff.”

“I would keep your mouth shut if I were you.” Sighing, Dad said, “You’re in enough trouble already.”

“But Dad...”

“Be quiet Andrew!”

I went silent as Michelle went back to her file. “I’m afraid these aren’t the first complaints we’ve received about your actions towards women.” Rifling through the file again, Michelle said, “In the last year alone, I’ve had to quash three sexual harassment lawsuits; one from a client who said you made sexist remarks towards her regarding her pregnancy.”

I think it’s only to note that I’ve been on the receiving end of pregnancy-related harassment a few times. Mainly from older clients who think a woman should focus on her family instead of her career.

“So what happens now?” with a cocky chuckle, I said, “Do I have to issue some apology and promise to treat women better?”

“You’ll have to participate in sensitivity training after which, yes, you’ll have to give each of the women an apology.”

“So I have to sit through some stupid class; that’ll be a piece of cake.”

Exchanging a look with Dad, Michelle turned to me and said, “I’m afraid it’s a little more complicated than that.” Pausing, she said, “In order for you to get the most out of the training; you’ll have to live as a woman for one year.”

I was in disbelief; there was no way Michelle was serious. “If that’s your idea of a joke, Michelle, it needs some serious work.”

“I’m not joking, Andrew.” Stepping around the desk, Michelle sat in front of me and said, “You’ll live as a woman for one year; experiencing the same harassment that other women experience every day.”

Ignoring Michelle, I turned to Dad as panic started to settle in. “Dad, please tell me you’re not going along with this.”

“You’re a problem, Andrew; one that practically writes its own hashtags.” Sighing, Dad looked at me and said, “Thankfully this is a problem with a solution.”

“What are you talking about, Dad?”

“It’s abundantly clear that you don’t respect women the way you should; based on the complaints and the contempt your showing Michelle.” Getting up, Dad leaned across the desk and said, “I can only imagine how you’d be having this conversation if it was with your mother or sister.”

It was becoming abundantly clear that the conversation was turning against me. If Dad was willing to turn me into a woman, what would he do if I resisted? Dozens of worst-case scenarios started to play through my mind – chief among them the idea that I’d be cut off. Trying to improve the situation, I said, “Alright, so maybe I do have a problem with women.”

“You don’t have a problem with women, Andrew; you ARE a problem with women.” Gesturing to Michelle, Dad said, “Thankfully Michelle has given us a solution to that problem once and for all.”

“Dad, you’re talking about turning me INTO a woman!”

“That’s right.” Sighing, Dad said, “Maybe then you’ll realize how terrible you’ve treated them.”

I wish I could go back and tell my past self not to worry; that what was coming wasn’t the end of the world. Getting up, I headed towards the door. “You’re crazy if you think I’ll let you get away with this.”

“If you go out that door I’m cutting you out of my will.” Sighing, Dad said, “You’ll be left with nothing; no job, no inheritance, nothing.”

I reached out to grab the doorknob, only to stop and pull back.
11.title: The Beginning

111.content:
Those people that knew George Benson well knew that he wasn’t the joking type. I may not have believed that he was serious about turning me into a woman, but I wasn’t about to risk being cut off. Turning around, I walked back to the desk and sat down. “Let’s say I believe you; what happens to me now?”

“Security will be asked to escort you from the building; we’ll come up with some reason to explain why you had to leave.” Looking at me, Dad said, “After the procedure, you’ll have one day to adjust and then you’ll be back here on Wednesday for your first day as a secretary.”

I couldn’t believe this was really happening. Taking a breath, I said, “Just so we’re clear on this; are you going to turn me into some middle-aged woman like Ms. Potts?”

For the record, Ms. Potts is a lovely woman. She gave me these lovely hand-made hats and mittens for the boys while I was pregnant.

“No, we won’t be doing that.” Sighing, Dad said, “As satisfying as that would be; you’ll be the same age you are now.”

While Dad reached for his phone, probably to call security, I turned my attention to Michelle. “I’m curious about one thing; what happens if I don’t learn my lesson?”

“If you haven’t learned your lesson to the satisfaction of your father, you’ll be forced to remain as a woman permanently.” Looking at me, she said, “At which time you will be removed from your father’s will and forbidden from ever contacting the family again.”

“Spending a year as a woman should be a piece of cake.” With a cocky smile, I said, “After being one for that long, I’ll have no problem getting women once I’m my old self again.”

“I must ask that you take this seriously, Andrew.”

Ignoring Michelle’s comment, I turned my attention to Dad as he got off the phone. Looking at me, he said, “Security will be waiting for you at the entrance; where they’ll escort you to your car and make sure you leave the property.”

“Whatever you say, Dad.” Getting annoyed by the whole situation, I stood up and said, “I’ll see you on Wednesday.”
111.title: Reluctantly Agree

1111.content:
I hadn’t expected to be let go from my job today, so I didn’t have anything planned. After making a stop of the liquor store, I drove back to my condo. With a 6 pack of beer in hand, I walked out onto the enclosed porch and looked out over the river.

As I took out a bottle to drink, I started thinking about the absurd punishment I was given for something I didn’t do. I did later realize that what I’d done to those girls was wrong, but at that point, I wasn’t ready to accept it.

**************************


I was looking out over the water, drinking my 3rd bottle of beer, when I heard a knock at the door. I wondered who could possibly be at the door; since, as far as anyone knew, I was supposed to be at work.

Bottle in hand, I walked through the main room. Opening the door, I found my younger sister Emily standing there; an inter-office envelope in her hands. Emily and I both worked for Dad; while I worked in the Accounting Department, she worked in the Legal Department. Looking at her standing then, in her neatly pressed skirt suit, I said, “What do you want, Emily?”

“Considering the trouble you’re in, Andrew; I’d drop the attitude.” Walking through the door, Emily said, “Dad sent me over here to have you sign a contract saying you agreed to do this.”

“I was pressured into agreeing with this.” Closing the door, I said, “I’m not signing anything that involves me becoming a woman.”

Emily made her way towards the kitchen area; helping herself to a bottle of water from my fridge. Bitch doesn’t even ask; she just goes right ahead. “Look, I’m not happy about this either; I can’t stand the idea of both of us sharing the same gender.” Placing the envelope on the counter, Emily said, “But it’s either this or you’re cut from the will.”

“I would’ve thought you of all people would love to have me out of the will.” Sighing, I said, “With me gone that would mean more for you.”

To this day I regret saying that; because Emily is one of the hardest working people I know. She could’ve gotten a job at a major firm in the city, but she decided to work for Dad instead.

“While that does appeal to me, I still think it’s in your best interest to sign this.”

“You realize what they want me to do, right?” scoffing, I said, “Dad and that bitch Michelle think that forcing me to be a woman will help me? What can I possibly learn from being a weak, pathetic woman that I don’t already know from being a guy?”

“How about learning what it’s like to be on the receiving end of sexual harassment?” looking at me, she said, “Then just maybe I could have my older brother back?”

Emily and I used to be inseparable as kids, but we slowly grew apart. We’re much closer now; doing activities that you’d typically see sisters doing together.

I started to realize that Emily wasn’t going to leave without me signing the contract. Putting the beer down, I said, “Just give me the damn thing so I can sign it and get you out of here.”

“Actually, once you sign it, I’m supposed to bring you to the hospital for the procedure.”

I begrudgingly signed the papers; while doing so, I looked at Emily said, “Tell me the truth; how long have you known about this?”

“Dad and Michelle came up with this idea months ago; after it became clear you were becoming a problem for the company.”
Leaning against the wall, Emily said, “But if you’re talking about what happened at the party; I found out that night. One of the girls that you harassed happened to be my assistant. After she told me what happened, I told her to file the complaint.”

“This was your idea?” slamming the pen down on the table, I said, “You’re the reason I have to spend the next year living as a woman?”

Unsettled by my outburst, Emily said, “As I said, this is for your own good.”

“We’ll see about that.” Shoving the contract towards Emily, I said, “There’s your stupid contract; now let's go to the hospital and get this over with.”
1111.title: Back Home

11111.content:
Had I not been drinking that day, I probably would have been suspicious when Emily insisted we take her car to the hospital. But in light of the fact that I’d already had 3 beers before noon, I wasn’t going to make a big deal about it.

As Emily drove down the road, I turned to her and said, “So what does Mom think of Dad’s plan?”

“She was hoping it wouldn’t come to this.” Sighing, Emily said, “But she agrees with dad that it’s for your own good.”

“So let me get this straight; everyone, including the bitch Michelle, knew about this plan except for me?” my head suddenly pounding, I said, “Don’t you think I should have been told about this?”

“Dad thought it would be better if you were kept in the dark.”

“Let’s say, for argument's sake, that I do mistreat women.” looking at Emily, I said, “Don’t you think I would’ve changed my attitude if I knew this could happen?”

“I guess we’ll never know now, will we?” coming to a stoplight, Emily retrieved another envelope from her back seat. Handing it to me, she said, “You should read this; it has everything you’ll need to know about the identity Dad had set up for you.”

I begrudgingly took the envelope from and poured the contents onto my lap. The first thing that caught my eye was a birth certificate that said – Amelia Renee Sullivan. There was also a social security card that said the same name. I started to wonder how they could create these documents when I realized they’d found a way to forcibly turn me into a woman.

It wasn’t until I found a small envelope containing keys; to both an apartment and a car, that I had to question what was happening. “What’s the deal with these keys, Emily?” looking at her, I said, “I already have a condo and a car.”

“Not anymore, you don’t.”

“What’s that supposed to mean?”

“Do you really think a secretary can afford to live in a $50,000 condo and drive a BMW?” turning to me, she said, “I’m afraid the best you can afford is a fourth-floor walkup and a 2003 Camry.”

“This is bullshit!” throwing everything on the ground, I said, “When Dad and Michelle forced this on me, they said nothing about me living like a poor person.”

*I feel I should mention that my dad’s company pays its secretaries very well.*

“I don’t know what to say, Amelia; that’s all you can afford on your salary.” Pulling into the hospital parking lot, Emily said, “Perhaps if you’d focused more on classes in college instead of sleeping around, you would’ve gotten a better job.”

As the two of us got out of the car, I turned to Emily and said, “Just so you know, I’m going to make sure everyone regrets doing this to me.”
11111.title: The Drive to the Hospital

111111.content:
Once we were inside the hospital, Emily and I took the elevator to the Out-Patient Surgery wing. She must’ve called ahead or something; because upon stepping out of the elevator, we were met with two nurses. They gestured for us to follow them down the hall; in doing so, I noticed them giving me looks of disdain. Do they know what’s about to happen to me?

Bringing me into an empty room, her disdain evident in her tone, one of the nurses handed me a hospital gown. “Take off your clothes and put this on.”

I’d barely had a chance to put on the gown before a doctor walked into the room. She looked to be in her mid-30s; part of me imagined asking her out if I’d seen her at a bar. “Are you Andrew Benson?”

I guess she’s not one for pleasantries. “Yeah; for a while longer at least.”

“Please lie down on the bed.” Walking towards me, with two syringes in her hand, she said, “I’m going to give you a muscle relaxer first; it’ll help make the procedure easier for you.”

[i}Lady, you’re talking about turning me into a woman. Nothing is going to make that easier for me. After I lied down on the bed, she injected me with the muscle relaxer; followed by the other injection. “So how is this supposed to work, anyway?”

“The procedure involves nanotechnology.” Removing her gloves, the doctor said, “I should warn you; if you should become pregnant, we won’t be able to reverse the procedure.”

Believe me lady; I have no intention of getting pregnant. “I’ll try to keep that in mind.”

Without saying another word, she left the room. I wanted to wave goodbye but suddenly found that I couldn’t move. I wanted to ask why, when my skin started tingling.

As I laid the table, unable to move, I became aware of two different sensations: a growing weight on my chest followed by an unnerving, diminishing feeling below my waist. Sorry girls, this wasn’t my idea.

*For the record, women aren’t as interested in the size of a man’s package as they think we are. What we really care about is whether they have a good personality.*

After about 10 minutes the tingling subsided and I got the feeling back in my limbs. I tried sitting up but found my sense of balance was off. After some trial and error, I corrected for the difference and sat up on the bed.

A few more minutes passed and I felt confident enough to try walking. I made my way across to a full-length mirror and got my first look at my new reflection.

I was now a hot blonde. Almost on impulse, I took off the gown and checked myself out. I had D-cup breasts and an hourglass figure. On top of that I couldn’t have been more than 5’5”; a far cry from just minutes earlier.

Giving my boobs a squeeze, I said, “At least I’m a good looking girl.”

Emily must’ve walked into the room at that point. “Congratulations; you’ve finally found a woman you can grope without her reporting you to HR.”
111111.title: The Procedure

1111111.content:
“I suppose this is your idea of a joke; turning me into a blonde.”

“This isn’t a joke, Andrew.” Sighing, Emily said, “God, this is supposed to teach you a lesson.”

“Teach me a lesson about what?” scoffing, I said, “How I shouldn’t objectify women?”

“That’s exactly it.” With a grin, Emily said, “To think people say blondes aren’t that bright.”

*I can’t stand that stereotype. My sister-in-law is blonde and she’s one of the smartest people I know.*

Sitting back down on the bed, I said, “So what happens now?”

“That’s entirely up to you; since you don’t start work again until Wednesday.” Looking at me, Emily said, “Might I suggest taking a day to adjust.”

“It’s going to take longer than a day for me to adjust to this.” Getting annoyed, I said, “Dammit Emily, I can’t believe you guys did this to me.”

“First off; you brought this on yourself.” Taking a breath, Emily said, “Secondly; get all those Dads and Emily’s out of your system. Come Wednesday it’s going to be Mr. Benson and Ms. Benson.”

“Are you serious?”

“You aren’t Andrew Benson anymore; legally you’re Amelia Sullivan.” Pausing, Emily said, “For the next year we’re not family; you’re just an underling working for my dad’s company.”

*******************************


Emily left a short time later; but not before leaving me with some clothes to change into. I wanted to scream at her when I saw the clothes she’d left me – a dress that showed off too much cleavage, even by my standards, and some knee-high boots.

I stood by the bed, staring at the clothes for what seemed like an eternity. Part of me was tempted to just walk out in the hospital gown, but that wasn’t a very good idea. With little recourse, I begrudgingly changed into the outfit. I stumbled a few times as I walked down the hall but thankfully I didn’t fall.

As I walked past the nurses’ station, one of the nurses said, “Ms. Sullivan?”

I almost continued walking until I remembered that was my name now. Turning around, I walked back to the desk and said,
“Yes?”

Putting a purse on the counter, along with the set of keys from earlier, the nurse said, “These were left for you; along with a note.”

Digging through the purse, I found the note:

Ms. Sullivan,
Your car is parked on Level 4, Spot 110. Try not to be late on your first day.
Ms. Benson

After thanking the nurse, I grabbed everything and started towards the elevator. Once I was on the ground floor, I made my way out of the lobby; noticing some people looking at me as I walked past. If only they knew I wasn’t always a woman.

Arriving at the parking garage, I quickly found the 2003 Camry that was now my car. Looking at it, I couldn’t believe the piece of junk before me was my transportation for the next year. *The car was actually quite nice; I just didn’t want to admit it at that point.*

Getting into the car, I spent a few minutes making myself as comfortable as I could. Damn seatbelt keeps squishing my breasts. Once I was settled, I turned the car on and drove out of the garage. Stopping at the hospital exit, I wondered where I should go first.
1111111.title: After the Procedure

11111112.content:
As I drove through town, I formed a plan to force my family to turn me back. Settling on making a complete fool of myself in public, I decided to go to the mall to buy some outfits for the plan.

It was a quick 10-minute drive to the mall; I parked close to the entrance so I didn’t have far to walk. As I made my way to the door I noticed a man, probably a few years younger than me, standing by the door. Why’s this guy just standing there?

I was about to ask what he was doing when he suddenly reached over and opened the door for me. Surprised by the gesture, all
I could manage was a quick ‘thank you’ as I walked by. The man smiled and said, “You’re welcome, ma’am.”

As I walked into the mall, I turned around and caught a glimpse of the guy staring at my ass before I rounded the corner. If only he knew the truth about me.

I quickly made my way through the mall to Macy’s; where I found myself looking through the dresses they had on the wall. I was looking at a black dress when a sales clerk walked up to me. “Can I help you, ma’am?”

Turning in the direction of the voice, I saw a young girl standing there; probably no more than 18 or 19. If I had been a guy, I totally would’ve been flirting with her right now. “Yeah, I’m looking for something that I can wear to the club.” Putting on a fake smile, I said, “I just broke up with my boyfriend and I could totally go for some rebound sex.”

“Well, you definitely have an eye for fashion.” Smiling, the girl said, “I wear a dress similar to this when I go clubbing with my girls. With this dress and your figure, you’ll be very popular in the club scene.”

That was just what I wanted to hear; if my family caught wind of me hanging out the clubs with a bunch of guys, they’d quickly decide to change me back. *I can’t believe how naïve I was back then.*

“Thanks for the advice.” Smiling, I said, “I think I’ll take this one.”

The girl smiled and walked off; giving me a chance to check her out as she did. Taking the dress off the rack, I went over to a mirror and held it up to my body. Damn girl, you’ll look hot in this!

With the dress in hand, I went to the register to pay for it. It was only then that I wondered how I was going to do so; Emily had mentioned I no longer had access to my bank account. Digging through the purse, I found a debit card from a local bank. I guess that’s better than nothing.

After paying for the dress, I decided to get something to eat at the food court before leaving. I can only imagine what people were thinking when they saw me scarf down a huge cheeseburger. *I thankfully rarely eat fast food now; mostly when I’m out shopping with the twins. Otherwise, I try my best to maintain my figure.*

Once I was done at the mall, I walked back out to the car. As I got inside, I quickly realized I was close to my mom's art gallery. Emily had told me Mom knew what Dad had planned for me, but I had to find out for myself.
11111112.title: The Mall

111111121.content:
While Emily and I had followed in Dad’s footsteps, my mom had started her own art gallery downtown. My mom, Darlene Benson, was a very persuasive woman; people generally did what she asked them to do without question. It was my hope that she could convince Dad to change me back.

Parking in front of the gallery, I put on my best impression of a cheerful woman and walked inside. I was slowly getting the hang of walking in heels, but each click-clack on the tile floor served as a reminder that I was no longer a man.

*I generally try not to wear heels if I can avoid them; they’re terrible on my back. I usually only wear them on special occasions, but I find I can’t wait to get out of them.*

Walking up to the front counter, putting on a smile, I looked at the young woman behind the counter and said, “Hi, my name is Amelia Sullivan; I’d like to speak with the owner about making a purchase.”

“Of course, I’ll see if she’s available.” Gesturing to a set of nearby chairs, the woman said, “If you have a seat, I’ll let you know when she’s available.”

“Thank you.”

***********************


I ended up sitting in the waiting area for about 20 minutes before the receptionist said, “Mrs. Benson can see you now, ma’am.”

After giving a polite wave as I walked by, I made my way through the glass doors that led to Mom’s office. Arriving outside the door, I peeked inside to find Mom looking at a file on her desk.

Walking inside the office, I closed the door behind me. In as derisive a tone as possible, in an attempt to show my anger about what was happening, I said, “Hello mother.”

Startled, Mom dropped the file and looked at me. “Andrew, is that you?”
111111121.title: At Mom's Art Gallery

1111111211.content:
“Don’t act surprised, Mom.” Walking over, I sat in a chair across from her. “Emily told me you were in on this.”

“I truly wish it hadn’t come to this, Amelia.”

“Don’t call me that!” getting frustrated, I said, “My name is Andrew, and no amount of paperwork and procedures is going to change that.”

Getting up, Mom walked around her desk until she was in front of me. “I’m sorry it came to this, Amelia; but this is for your own good.”

“That’s bullshit and you know.” Sighing, I said, “Do you really think this is going to change how I act around women?”

“Yes, I sincerely believe this will help you.” With a smile, Mom said, “When it’s all over, I suspect you’ll be thanking us for putting you through this.

“I highly doubt that.”

*I wouldn't call my mother psychic, but she was right on the money. I thank them every time I see them.*

“What did you think was going to happen when you came here?” looking at me, Mom said, “Did you think I’d take your side and convince your father to change you back?”

“Yeah, I had hoped you’d be reasonable about this.”

“I’m afraid I won’t be able to change you back early, but I will do something for you.” Getting up, Mom said, “Your father won’t like this if he finds out, but my door is always open if you need someone to talk to.”

I was confused as to why Mom was saying that. Looking at her, I said, “Emily told me I couldn’t act like you guys were family.”

“I’m certain she meant at the office; where it would be hard to explain.” Pausing, Mom said, “I’m not saying you can approach me if I’m with your father, but I’m still your mother and I want to help you.”

“Thank you.” Genuinely touched, I said, “I-I really appreciate that, mom.”

*I wasn’t devoid of all respect for women, even back then. I still appreciated when my mom helped me through something.*

“Now I suggest you leave; because your father is coming to take me to lunch.” Pulling me in for a hug, Mom said, “I love you sweetie, and I know you’ll get through this.”

I suddenly found myself not wanting to let go of Mom, but I knew Dad wouldn’t like it if I was here. “I love you too, mom.”

1111111211.title: Talking with Mom

11111112111.content:

If I hated what the place looked like on the outside, my opinion of the inside wasn’t that far off. The apartment consisted of a small living area; with a detached kitchen to one side plus a hallway leading to a bathroom and bedroom. The furniture, from what I could tell, was rather old; reminding me of something you’d see in a retirement home.

*The apartment wasn’t actually all that bad; I just didn’t want to admit it at the time.*

Walking into the bedroom, I noticed the closet was filled with an assortment of dresses and skirt suits. Throwing the dress I’d just bought on the bed, I collapsed onto the mattress. “This has to be a dream; this can’t really be my life now.”

After lying there for a few minutes, I sat up and found my attention drawn to a series of picture frames on the dresser. For the second time today, I was surprised by the kindness shown me by two women who I didn’t know. “Sounds like a plan to me, I’ll see you then.”

Just great; not only did Dad fire me, but they promoted the last I guy I hired and made him my boss. Placing my things on my new desk, I grabbed one of the lighter boxes and followed him into the other room. “If I may ask, sir; how did you get this job?”

“It’s all about who you know, sweet-cheeks,” looking at me, Mr. Lewis, “The last guy and I were in the same Frat; we went to different schools and graduated in different years, but that didn’t matter.”

I was suddenly remembering why I’d hired this guy; he was right, we had been in different chapters of the same Frat. We all looked out for each other no matter what. “Being frat brothers qualified you for this job?”

“Not on its own, no; but yesterday he left me a voicemail, something about going into rehab and taking a ‘voyage of self-discovery.’” Pausing, he said, “Apparently he hand-picked me to run the department while he was gone.”

Like hell I did; Dad and Michelle must’ve worked out a way to get him the job without him questioning it.

*******************************

It took us several hours to get the office to his liking. It was just around 2:30 when we finally finished. “Well I think that’s all for today. I’m going to leave early; you can too, sweetheart.”

It was all I could do not to the guy a new asshole when he slapped my ass.

*Guess you can dish it out, but you can't take it, huh, old me?*
1121111.title: Arriving at Work

11211112.content:
Having been focused on getting to work this morning, I didn’t have much time to look at the apartment complex that I’d be living in for the next year. I think my initial reaction to the apartment was because I was shocked to find I’d turned into a woman. The complex and the unit itself weren’t all that bad; it wasn’t up to my standards but it wasn’t that bad.

After walking up to the 4th floor, I fumbled with the key for a moment before finally getting inside the apartment. The first thing I did once I was inside was take off the heels; which immediately made my feet feel so much better.

*I still don’t know why women wear heels. Sure they make us look good, but was it really worth all the joint problems later in life.*

Standing in the middle of the room, I said to myself, “I suppose I should look around this place.”

The apartment consisted mainly of a small living area; with a detached kitchen plus a small hallway leading to down to the bathroom and bedroom. Feeling an urge to get out of the skirt suit, I rummaged through the closet until I finally found something that wasn’t remotely feminine – a pair of paints and a shirt. Getting dressed was a hassle; apparently I had no problem taking bras off but had trouble putting one on.

Once I was satisfied with my outfit, I turned to leave the room; only to stop when my attention was drawn to some photos on the dresser. Going over for a closer look, I saw there were pictures of me; or at least the female me. That wasn’t the only thing that caught my attention – the photos were of me with other people in a variety of locations; college graduation, on a beach wearing a bikini, and what looked to be some formal dance with other girls.

If they can turn me into a girl, I suppose it’s not too hard to make some fake photos. Leaving the bedroom, I decided now was a good time to get drunk. Thankfully whoever stocked the fridge had the foresight to provide me with some beer – it wasn’t the brand I typically drank, but it would still get me drunk.
11211112.title: Back at the apartment

112111121.content:
A few hours passed before I finally stopped drinking; leaving 5 empty bottles on the floor. I was starting to get hungry when I heard voices outside in the hallway. For some reason they both sounded familiar; so I got up to see who they were.

Opening the door, I two woman standing there; a brunette and a red-head, both wearing skirt suits. The brunette took one look at me and said, “We weren’t making too much noise, were we?”

“No, you’re fine.” Sighing, I said, “I’m just not having the best day.”

“Join the club, girlfriend.” Gesturing to the red-head, she said, “I’m Marcy and this is Robin.”

I still couldn’t place where I knew them from; but they both looked familiar, particularly the red-head. Shaking Marcy’s hand, I said, “I’m Amelia.”

“Wait a minute, you look kind of familiar.”

Oh crap; could they know I’m Andrew? “You guys do too, I’m trying to figure out why.”

After a moment, Robin said, “Wait; aren’t you that new secretary that started today?”

That’s where I know them from – work! “You guys work at Benson Financial?”

“Yeah; I’m in Accounting and Robin’s in the Legal Department.” Looking at me, Marcy said, “You’re Mr. Lewis’ new secretary,
right?”

“Yeah.” Thinking back to the butt slapping, I said, “He’s kind of grabby, isn’t he?”

“He’s nothing like the last guy.” Shuddering, Robin said, “Andrew Benson was the worst man I’ve ever known.”

Damn Robin, what did I ever do to you? Looking at me, Marcy said, “I apologize for Robin; she’s still upset about the July 4th Party – Mr. Benson tried to force himself on her.”

Oh crap. Trying to play it cool, I said, “That’s terrible, Robin; I’m so sorry.”

“It’s not your fault; it’s not like you did it.”

“Okay, why don’t we change the subject here.” Looking at me, Marcy said, “Robin and I are going to clubbing tonight, you feel like joining us?”

Going clubbing wasn’t exactly my idea of fun, but it would get me out of the apartment. Besides, it might give me a chance to embarrass my family. With a smile, I said, “Sure, sounds like a date!"
112111121.title: A Few Hours Later

1121111211.content:
I found a little black dress in my closet. Remembering something an ex-girlfriend said about the versatility of little black dresses, I realized that must be why I was given one. Well, Daddy Dearest, just wait 'til you see what use I put it to.

At the club, the first thing we dealt with was the two-drink minimum. Halfway through her second Long Island Iced Tea, Robin was feeling talkative, and the subject she wished to hold forth on was none other than yours truly, Andrew Benson.

"You know what that rat bastard said to me after he gave me a tonsilectomy with his tongue? 'You're welcome.' You're. Freaking. Welcome."

She probably didn't say freaking, I may have misremembered. Remember, I had pre-gamed with 5/6 of a six-pack.

"You know what I'd like, most of all?" she asked.

"For him to be right here in front of you," I guessed, "so you can tell him what you think of him?" 'Cause, if so, your prayers have been answered.

"No. What I want... " She held up the candle on the table. "I wish he was a woman, and some rat bastard man treats him the way he treated me." She tried to blow out the candle, but it didn't work, because it was electric.

*She got her wish anyway.*

A waitress brought us fresh drinks. "Compliments of the gentlemen at the bar," she said.

We looked over, acting nonchalant. They were there, acting like buying a woman a drink in a bar was a feat akin to curing cancer.

"Shall we?" asked Marcy, already standing up.

The three of us walked over to the guys. I don't know what Marcy had in mind, but it probably wasn't what I did.

Because I picked out one of the guys, walked right up to him, and gave him a deep-mouth kiss that brought him to his knees. Like I said, I had been drinking.

*Yeah, just keep telling yourself that, past me.*
